User Story/Use Case: As a user, I want to log in with my email and password so that the system can authenticate me and show my dashboard
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): User can enter credentials. System validates against all user lists. Correct dashboard (Student, Organizer, Admin) opens on success. Error message shows on failure

User Story/Use Case: As a Student, I want to see a dashboard with a list of all available events so that I can see what's happening
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): Dashboard loads after login. A ListView shows all "Active" events from the database

User Story/Use Case: As a Student, I want to register for an event so that I can reserve my spot
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): Register" button is present. Clicking it adds a Registration to the Event and Student. App checks for event capacity and existing registration. Data is saved to XML

User Story/Use Case: As a Student, I want to create my own event so that I can organize a study group or small activity
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): "Create Event" button opens a new form. Form validates all fields (title, time, room, capacity)

User Story/Use Case: As an Event Organizer, I want to see a dashboard with only the events I have created
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): When an EventOrganizer logs in, a new dashboard opens. The list shows only events where event.getOrganizer() matches the current user

User Story/Use Case: As an Event Organizer, I want to cancel an event I created
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): "Cancel" button is on the dashboard. Clicking it sets the event.status to "Cancelled". The change is saved to XML

User Story/Use Case: As an Event Organizer, I want to see a list of students who have registered for my event
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): "View Registrations" button opens a new popup window. The window lists all students for the selected event

User Story/Use Case: As an Administrator, I want to have a dashboard so I can perform my admin duties
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): When an Administrator logs in, a new "Admin Dashboard" window opens.

User Story/Use Case: As an Administrator, I want to manage user accounts so I can assign roles
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): Admin dashboard has a "Manage Users" UI. Admin can see a list of all users. Admin can change a Student account to an EventOrganizer

User Story/Use Case: As an Administrator, I want to manage rooms so I can add or remove bookable locations
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): Admin dashboard has a "Manage Rooms" UI. Admin can add a new Room with name/capacity. Admin can delete an existing Room. Changes are saved to XML

User Story/Use Case: As an Administrator, I want to generate reports on event participation.
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): Admin dashboard has a "Generate Report" button. Clicking it displays the output in a new window

User Story/Use Case: As a new user, I want to create a new Student account so I can use the system
Acceptance Criteria (When is it done?): The Login screen has a "Create Account" button. This opens a new form for self-registration. A new Student object is created and saved to XML
